::: {#about-me style="text-align: center;"}
I'm a senior researcher and data scientist in the [sport psychology lab](https://www.sportwissenschaft.uni-konstanz.de/schueler/schueler/research/sport-psychology-lab/) at the University of Konstanz, Germany. My interestes include human motivation, effort, and performance in basic and applied research. I passionately use R for data science and in my general workflow.
:::

# {{< iconify fluent megaphone-loud-16-filled >}} News

## Out Now: Handbook of Boredom

::: columns
::: {.column width="70%"}
The Handbook of Boredom is now available! It brings together leading boredom researchers from various disciplines and provides a unique exploration of boredom. 

What's inside:

- Foundations: Insights into a multitude of theoretical, conceptual, historical, and methodologial aspects of boredom.
- Correlates: Exploration of the properties of boredom and its links to self-control, mind-wandering, flow, and aggression.
- Contexts: Approaches to studying boredom in various life domains and its role for health, well-being, and aesthetic experience.

Bonus feature:

The final chapter is a collective effort of all contributors, offering a panaoramic view of the field and outlining future directions for research.

[Check it out!](https://www.routledge.com/The-Routledge-International-Handbook-of-Boredom/Bieleke-Wolff-Martarelli/p/book/9781032221861){.external target="_blank"}
:::
